title: If I Were Rich
content: If it rains tomorrow, I [will stay|stay|stayed|would stay] home. If I [won|win|wins|have won] the lottery, I would buy a boat. If I had studied harder, I [would have passed|would pass|pass|passed] the exam. If water reaches 100 degrees, it [boils|boiled|will boil|would boil]. If I [were|am|was|be] you, I would apologize. If she comes, call me. Use [Zero|First|Second|Third] Conditional for facts. Use [Second|First|Zero|Third] Conditional for hypothetical situations.

explanation-en-US:
# ğŸ’­ If I Were Rich (Conditionals)

1. **First Conditional (Real Future)**: If it rains, I **[will stay]** home.
2. **Second Conditional (Hypothetical)**: If I **[won]** (imaginary past form), I would buy...
   - If I **[were]** you...
3. **Third Conditional (Regret)**: If I had studied, I **[would have passed]**.
4. **Zero Conditional (Facts)**: Water **[boils]** at 100 degrees.

title: Zero: Ice
content: If you heat ice, it [melts|melted]. If it rains, the ground [gets|got] wet.

title: Zero: Mix
content: If you mix red and blue, you [get|got] purple. If babies are hungry, they [cry|cried].

title: First: Rain
content: If it rains, helps I [will stay|stay] home. If she comes, we [will go|go].

title: First: Study
content: If you study, you [will pass|pass]. If you hurry, you [will catch|catch] the bus.

title: Second: Rich (Unreal)
content: If I were rich, I [would buy|will buy] a boat. If I had time, I [would travel|will travel].

title: Second: King
content: If I [were|was] you, I would go. If he [were|is] here, he would help.

title: Third: Past Unreal
content: If I had known, I [would have come|will come]. If she had seen him, she [would have said|said] hello.

title: Third: Failed
content: If we had played better, we [would have won|won]. If it hadn't rained, we [would have gone|went].

title: Unless
content: I won't go [unless|if] you go. You will fail [unless|if] you study.

title: Wish Present
content: I wish I [knew|know] the answer. I wish it [were|is] sunny.

title: Wish Past
content: I wish I [had gone|went] there. I wish I [had not eaten|did not eat] so much.

title: As Long As
content: You can go [as long as|unless] you are quiet. I will help [provided that|unless] you ask properly.

title: In Case
content: Take an umbrella [in case|if] it rains. Call me [in case|if] you need help.

title: Mixed
content: If I had slept (past), I [would be|would have been] awake now (present).
